content.text:
Based on this application description, generate a short, concise name suitable for use as a GitHub repository name.
The name should be lowercase with words separated by hyphens (kebab-case) and should not include any special characters.
Application description: "A simple web application that displays a click counter. The counter value is stored persistently in a database on the backend. The frontend will have a button that, when clicked, increments the counter and updates the displayed value."
Return ONLY the name, nothing else.

<reason>The frontend displays a button and a counter that increments on click. The errors in the console logs are related to the backend (Internal Server Error, TRPCClientError). The frontend part, responsible for displaying the counter and updating it on button click, seems to be implemented correctly.</reason>
<answer>yes</answer>

Given the attached screenshot, decide where the frontend code is correct and relevant to the original prompt. Keep in mind that the backend is currently not implemented, so you can only validate the frontend code and ignore the backend part.
Original prompt to generate this website: A simple web application that displays a click counter. The counter value is stored persistently in a database on the backend. The frontend will have a button that, when clicked, increments the counter and updates the displayed value..

Console logs from the browsers:

chromium:
[debug] [vite] connecting...
[debug] [vite] connected.
[info] %cDownload the React DevTools for a better development experience: https://react.dev/link/react-devtools font-weight:bold
[error] Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 (Internal Server Error)
[error] Failed to load counter: TRPCClientError: Failed to execute 'json' on 'Response': Unexpected end of JSON input
    at _TRPCClientError.from (http://debughost:5173/node_modules/.vite/deps/@trpc_client.js?v=)
    at http://debughost:5173/node_modules/.vite/deps/@trpc_client.js?v=
[error] Failed to load counter: TRPCClientError: Failed to execute 'json' on 'Response': Unexpected end of JSON input
    at _TRPCClientError.from (http://debughost:5173/node_modules/.vite/deps/@trpc_client.js?v=)
    at http://debughost:5173/node_modules/.vite/deps/@trpc_client.js?v=
webkit:
[debug] [vite] connecting...
[debug] [vite] connected.
[error] Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 (Internal Server Error)
[error] Failed to load counter: TRPCClientError: The string did not match the expected pattern.
[error] Failed to load counter: TRPCClientError: The string did not match the expected pattern.

Answer "yes" or "no" wrapped in <answer> tag. Explain error in logs if it exists. Follow the example below.

Example 1:
<reason>the website looks valid</reason>
<answer>yes</answer>

Example 2:
<reason>there is nothing on the screenshot, rendering issue caused by unhandled empty collection in the react component</reason>
<answer>no</answer>

Example 3:
<reason>the website looks okay, but displays database connection error. Given it is not frontend-related, I should answer yes</reason>
<answer>yes</answer>
feat: Implement click counter with persistent storage

Based on this application description, generate a concise Git commit message that follows best practices.
The message should be clear, descriptive, and follow conventional commit format.
Application description: "A simple web application that displays a click counter. The counter value is stored persistently in a database on the backend. The frontend will have a button that, when clicked, increments the counter and updates the displayed value."
Return ONLY the commit message, nothing else.

<reason>The application loads correctly and displays the "Click Counter" application with emojis as requested. The application functions as expected.</reason>
<answer>yes</answer>

Given the attached screenshot and browser logs, decide where the app is correct and working.
 User prompt: 
Enhance the frontend (`client/src/App.tsx`) by adding emojis to the displayed text. Specifically, I want to add emojis to:
- The main title "Click Counter"
- The "Click Me!" button text
- The "Loading..." text
- The "Incrementing..." text

Make sure the emojis are relevant and add to the fun aspect of the application.
 
Console logs from the browsers:

chromium:
[debug] [vite] connecting...
[debug] [vite] connected.
[info] %cDownload the React DevTools for a better development experience: https://react.dev/link/react-devtools font-weight:bold
webkit:
[debug] [vite] connecting...
[debug] [vite] connected.

Answer "yes" or "no" wrapped in <answer> tag. Explain error in logs if it exists. Follow the example below.

Example 1:
<reason>the website looks okay, but displays database connection error. Given we evaluate full app, I should answer no</reason>
<answer>no</answer>

Example 2:
<reason>there is nothing on the screenshot, rendering issue caused by unhandled empty collection in the react component</reason>
<answer>no</answer>

Example 3:
<reason>the website looks valid</reason>
<answer>yes</answer>
